name: PO vs SO vs Billing
query:
SELECT
    -- Site Details
    site.customer AS "Customer:Link/Customer:200",
    site.name AS "Circuit ID:Data:150",
    site.site_name AS "Site Name:Data:200",
    site.site_status AS "Site Status:Data:150",
    site.sales_order AS "SO No:Link/Sales Order:150",

    -- Sales Order Details
    so.transaction_date AS "SO Date:Date:120",
    so.status AS "SO Status:Data:120",
    so.total AS "Basic SO Amount:Currency:120",
    so.po_no AS "PO No:Data:150",
    so.po_date AS "PO Date:Date:120",
    so.custom_po_end_date AS "PO End Date:Date:120",
    so.custom_customer_purchase_amount AS "PO Amount:Currency:120",

    -- Sales Invoice Details
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.name SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Sales Invoice No:Data:200",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.posting_date SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Invoice Date:Date:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.custom_start_date SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Start Date:Date:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.custom_end_date SEPARATOR ', ') AS "End Date:Date:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.status SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Invoice Status:Data:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.total SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Basic Invoice Amount:Currency:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.total_taxes_and_charges SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Tax Amount:Currency:120",
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT si.rounded_total SEPARATOR ', ') AS "Total Invoiced with Tax:Currency:120"

FROM
    `tabSite` site

LEFT JOIN
    `tabSales Order` so 
        ON site.sales_order = so.name

LEFT JOIN
    `tabSales Invoice` si 
        ON site.sales_order = si.custom_sales_order

GROUP BY
    site.customer,
    site.name,
    site.site_name,
    site.site_status,
    site.sales_order,
    so.transaction_date,
    so.status,
    so.total,
    so.po_no,
    so.po_date,
    so.custom_po_end_date,
    so.custom_customer_purchase_amount;
